pubinfo.publish: Minnesota DNR - Division of Fish & Wildlife - Fisheries Unit

descript.abstract:
This layer shows waterbodies that have been treated for fish removal (i.e., "reclaimed") by DNR Fisheries. Some waterbodies have had multiple treatments (i.e., reclamation events). Lake and river polygons are symbolized by the number of different treatment events the waterbody has had (see attribute [RECLAM_APPS]). Additional attributes for each event are found in a related table (below). Related table: water_fisheries_reclamation_events_relate Attributes include: treatment date, species targeted, method used, chemical(s) applied and project cost To access related table records:
  • Open the layer attribute table and select a lake polygon record
  • From the Related Table dropdown (2nd icon on bar just above table), choose table reclamation events: to event by year
  • The related table will open and the corresponding records for the selected lake will be highlighted.
  • Note: You can also select records from the related table and find the lakes that correspond to those records by reversing the process above (i.e., Choose Related Tables dropdown (2nd icon), choose table reclamation events: Back to reclaimed lakes)
    • The user can also access the related records by clicking on the lake of interest with the Identify Tool and expanding the related tabular information.
descript.purpose: For DNR staff and other parties interested in the reclamation history of a waterbody.

timeperd.current: Re-delineations and edits are frequent and occur as needed. See the attributes DELINEATON_DATE and DELINEATION_SRC for date and source of each polygon. See CONTENT_DATE for last date of attribute updates.

citeinfo.title: DNR Hydrography - Lakes and Open Water

procstep.procdesc: Treatment information comes from Reclaim.mdb, an Access database maintained by DNR Fisheries. Polygons are from the DNR Hydrography - Lakes and Open Water layer.

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number of waterbody features in DNR Hydrography SDE - Open Water Features

A unique Fisheries Waterbody ID for joining/linking polygons to DNR Fisheries Lake Survey DB (Oracle). FW_IDs are assigned based on how the waterbody is managed by DNR Fisheries (i.e., an FW_ID may correspond to an entire basin '00' or to a specific sub-basin '01','02',etc.

edom.edomvd: A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing an alternate representation of a basin (implemented in SDE Dataset only)
A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing a non-MN portion of a border water

attr.attrdef: Waterbody ID per DNR Ecological and Water Resources (EWR) Division's LAKESDB database; the DOWLKNUM may end in"00" (entire basin) or "01","02", etc. (sub-basin)
Public Water (Lake) Name per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Identifies whether basin is a sub-basin of a larger complex of basins

edom.edomvd: Yes, is a sub-basin; DOWLKNUM usually ends in '01', '02, '03, etc.
No, is not a sub-basin; DOWLKNUM usually ends in '01', '02, '03, etc.

attr.attrdef: Hydrologic feature type; based on original USCLASS attribute from USGS 100K DLG dataset; some polygons have been reclassified to better indicate their current hydrologic state
Lake Class per DNR Fisheries Investigational Report #417 - Schupp 1992 http://files.dnr.state.mn.us/publications/fisheries/investigational_reports/417.pdf
Surface area of waterbody in acres
Perimeter of shoreline in miles (includes island shoreline)
UTM Easting (X) of waterbody center
UTM Northing (Y) of waterbody center
County Name
DNR Administrative Region
DNR Fisheries Administrative Areas (Fisheries Office)
Identifies border waters

edom.edomvd: Polygon (portion of border lake) that is outside of MN
Lake is not a border lake (outside of MN)

attr.attrdef: Person/unit/source of polygon delineation
Date of polygon delineation or shape update.
Photo imagery source used for digitizing polygon feature

edom.edomvd: Public Water (PWI) polygon representing the Ordinary High Water Level (OHWL)

attr.attrdef: Any notes related to the delineation.
Date the lake polygon source layer was re-published following updates.
Flag indicating whether the lake is a reclaimed lake.

edom.edomvd: Yes, the lake is a reclaimed lake
No, the lake is not a reclaimed lake

attr.attrdef: Number of reclamation applications (events) on lake
Unique GIS record number of waterbody features in DNR Hydrography SDE - Open Water Features

A unique Fisheries Waterbody ID for joining/linking polygons to DNR Fisheries Lake Survey DB (Oracle). FW_IDs are assigned based on how the waterbody is managed by DNR Fisheries (i.e., an FW_ID may correspond to an entire basin '00' or to a specific sub-basin '01','02',etc.

edom.edomvd: A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing an alternate representation of a basin (implemented in SDE Dataset only)
A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing a non-MN portion of a border water

attr.attrdef: Waterbody ID per DNR Ecological and Water Resources (EWR) Division's LAKESDB database; the DOWLKNUM may end in"00" (entire basin) or "01","02", etc. (sub-basin)
DNR Division of Fisheries assigned stream identification number.
Public Water (Lake) Name per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
The common name of the fish species
Lake classification: Warmwater (W) or Coldwater (C)
The level of treatment: C = Complete, P = Partial, U = Unknown
Method of application used
Number of applications
Date of treatment
Year
Project funding source: G = grant; B = b-work unit; L = LCCMR; O = other.
Reimbursed: Yes (Y) or No (N)
The lake acreage used to calculate the amount of toxicant needed for treatment.
Acre Feet
Marsh Acres
Marsh Acre Feet
Gallons Rotenone
Pounds Rotenone
Units of Fintrol
Gallons of Toxaphene
Concentration in parts per billion
Indicates the amount and type of antimycin used
Cost Toxic
Cost of Project
Generalcomments
Date the layer-specific attributes were last updated

overview.eaover: fisheries_reclamation_events (feature class attribute table: The first set of attributes (DNR_HYDRO_ID through PUBLISH_DATE) are derived from and consistent with the Open Water feature class of the DNR Hydrography SDE Dataset. DNR Hydrography - Lakes and Open Water The remaining attributes are specific to this layer. water_fisheries_reclamation_events_relate (related table): For each reclamation event, record includes: date, method of lake reclamation, chemical types and amounts used, and species intended to benefit
overview.eadetcit: Data originally from Reclaim.mdb, an Access database maintained by DNR Fisheries.

distinfo.distliab: The Minnesota Department of Natural Resources General Geographic Data License Agreement is online: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/sitetools/data_software_license.html
